text:

Think twice before doing any business with them.

text: I sold a brand new Chloe handbag on Vestiaire on 14 Jul 2021, and they said payment was sent on 27 Jul 2021 (#16938363). author: No
text:
21 August 2021
Responding to Vestiaire-Collective, who responded to my first review (here below):

Thank you for taking the time to get back to me. It is nice to read an answer that is longer than 3 sentences, which is what I had received so far when contacting you via your “Help” or “How-to-contact-Vestiaire-Collective”, which is also why I have no intention to use those options, so no need to send these links again in future answer. 

I also feel that answering you here is far more helpful to other VC users. 

As written in my first review here below and as communicated with your “support” several times: the sale was canceled due to your mistake without even contacting the carrier nor myself. When I contact you (via your “support”), I provided with a proof that UPS and myself shipped the item on time. Moreover, the buyer did not cancel the sale but you did. She wrote me in a comment that she contact you because she didn’t understand why the sale was canceled. Strangely enough, you deleted these comments after the second time I contact your “support”. 

After the third chat with your “support” my item was sent back to me without any consulting nor mentioning the buyer. On the App however it is still “in progress — item assessment”. Strangely#2. 


I’m still waiting to your solution on this lost sale. To quote your motto and goal as written in your answer to me here below: “we will solve this issue because our staff has one and only goal: help our members until a satisfying solution and make you happy!”

Please solve.
ref. #11907221
title: Vestiaire-Collective not responding

author: Athina Kollakidou
text:
Hello Everyone, 

I am going through a horrible and frustrating situation, as a seller, with Vestiaire. I would strongly recommend not to trust your items with this company.

I sold a new Valentino belt. Never worn, with tags and box. Most likely the lady who bought it was intrigued by the price and the condition that she didn't check the size. Long story short she didn't fit in the belt, tried to close the buckle and damaged the belt. She then claimed that the belt was already damaged which it was 100% lies since I never worn the belt as it was huge on me. 

I have the belt pictures of the before I sent it and how the belt looks now and she totally destroyed it. 

Vestiaire don't even want to get involved, on the contrary they are so lazy that they said from the pictures she said the belt is obviously damaged due to wear and tear which is crazy that they come to this conclusion since they were the once approving the uploads in the first place (and they check the photos).

Seriously it's better to go in physical stores to re-sell your good rather than trust this company. 

Now i have an item that I can easily throw out from the damage and I lost 200£ all because of Vestiaire.

Don't trust them
title: Do not sell your items on Vestiaire

author: mona brar
text: Sold a hamilton watch, it took 6 months to arrive to us because the package kept getting lost and was damaged at one point. Eventually got it and the time on the watch came to a standstill around 28 days later. I was shocked of course and though its a slip of button. There after it became more frequent, now the watch cannot keep an accurate time at all and is slipping back hours. The watch was switched off when sent to me, which means it was not 'quality approved' for its mechanical mechanism ever. Surely this is the first thing you would check in a watch for quality insurance DUH! They said because its been more then 72 hours i can no longer return... hilariously sad. Goodbye to my husbands gift. LESSON don't buy from vestiaire. I read the bad reviews but thought id try it, boy oh boy did I learn the hard way.

author: Sophie
text: Worst online experience I’ve had. Do NOT trust their customer service. I ordered an item that was coming from Australia (where I am), but at checkout it added a huge amount of customs duties. I asked their customer service why this was the case and they assured me it was an error, and I would need to contact them after I placed the order to receive a refund. I ordered, and then when I contacted them I was told I do have to pay the fees. I had to speak to three people before it was explained the item is shipped offshore for authentication, then shipped back to me. At this point, I was offered to switch to direct shipping, so I said yes - but then was told sorry that’s not possible after ordering (not sure why they offered it in the first place!). I asked to cancel the order because with shipping, customs and authentication fees it was actually cheaper to buy the item brand new. I was then told that it can only be cancelled by the seller, so I needed to ask them (seller is actually penalised in this case - even though it was VCs fault). I ended up cancelling the order by going through my credit card company, as I kept screenshots of all the customer service interactions which showed multiple lies.
title: Horrible online experience

author: Amy D
text:
DO NOT USE VESTIAIRE COLLECTIVE!!!!
Purchase a saint laurent coat that was sold as womens UK size 14.  When it arrived it felt odd, sleeves very long, body very tight.  I brought it to Saint Laurent who confirmed it was a mans coat and not womens.  Contacted VC and was told that because it was not reported within 72 hours i had no rights.  Under the distance selling regulations 2000 i am covered as the item was mis sold to me as womens and not mens.  The CS agent i'm dealing with will not escalate my case and i'm now seeking legal advice.  The savings you think you're making are not worth it!!! Avoid at all costs.
title: DO NOT USE VESTIAIRE COLLECTIVE!!!!
